body_html: I think solution 1 will not work cause the first checkpoint is saved at startup. So as the checkpoint is ready the first eval will be executed at throttle secs and tf.estimator.RunConfig.save_checkpoints_steps will not be respected.
body_text: I think solution 1 will not work cause the first checkpoint is saved at startup. So as the checkpoint is ready the first eval will be executed at throttle secs and tf.estimator.RunConfig.save_checkpoints_steps will not  be respected.
body: I think solution 1 will not work cause the first checkpoint is saved at startup. So as the checkpoint is ready the first eval will be executed at throttle secs and `tf.estimator.RunConfig.save_checkpoints_steps` will not  be respected.
